metadata.title: CVE-2019-11008 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.4 snapshot-20190322 Q8, there is a heap-based buffer overflow in the function WriteXWDImage of coders/xwd.c, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted image file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-11008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.4~hg15968-1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.4~hg15968-1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.4~hg15968-1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.4~hg15968-1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.4~hg15968-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4~hg15968-1').
